issues.description: The following user accounts have GRANTs that are restricted and will be updated. MySQL HeatWave Service restricts certain privileges from regular user accounts so they will be removed from the grant list of accounts when created at the target database. All other things will remain the same, including password and remaining grants. Read more

issues.title: Restricted Grants

issues.description: The tables below do not have PRIMARY KEYs and will have one added. In order to offer High Availability, the MySQL HeatWave Service requires all tables to have either a PRIMARY KEY or a UNIQUE KEY on a NOT NULL column. The MySQL HeatWave Service will automatically and transparently add a Generated Invisible Primary Key (GIPK) to your migrated tables at the destination. You may select specific tables to be Excluded instead, if you prefer to not migrate them. MySQL HeatWave Service Pre-requisites
issues.result: <li>Table `sakila`.`table_to_drop` does not have a Primary Key, which is required for High Availability in MySQL HeatWave Service
issues.title: Table Missing Primary Key or Equivalent
